titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Norman L. Grover Papers, 1960-1992
titlestmt.subtitle: Grover, Norman L. Papers Ms1991-037

publicationstmt.date: ©2014 By Virginia Tech. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-12-09T10:44-0500

titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections Ms1991-037

defitem.label: Processed by: Betsy Reed, Graduate Assistant, Adrienne Glenney, Student Assistant, and Kira A. Dietz, Archivist,

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: Norman L. Grover Papers, 1960-1992
did.abstract: This collection contains the papers of Norman L. Grover a former professor in the Philosophy and Religion Department(s) at Virginia Tech from 1957-1991.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Norman L. Grover Papers must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: The Norman L. Grover Papers, Ms1991-037, Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was acquired by Special Collections in 2001.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Norman L. Grover Papers was completed in October 2014.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Norman L. Grover was a faculty member in the department of Philosophy and Religion and later the Department of Religion from 1957 until his retirement in 1994. He also served as head of the department from 1957-1975.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection encompasses a wide variety of materials including documents from the Department of Philosophy and Religion, the Humanities Program, and the College of Arts and Sciences Faculty Association. The collection also contains academic publications, information concerning campus events through the years, and materials from classes offered by the Departments of Philosophy and Religion from the 1960s through the 1990s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into series by subject type. Within each series, files are arranged in alphabetical order by folder title.

Series I: University Level Administrative Materials includes papers relating to the Virginia Tech chapter of the AAUP; memos and reports from the College of Arts and Sciences, University Council, and Faculty Senate; faculty handbooks; and state employee materials. Series II: Department of Philosophy and Religion Materials contains memos; course proposals and curriculum papers; faculty meeting minutes; and administrative documents.
Series III: Philosophy Major/Department Materials consists of administrative papers collected to establish the major, as well as advising records; honors society by-laws; and faculty memos.
Series IV: Religion Major/Department Materials includes degree and major proposals; higher education files on curriculum; correspondence; and informational flyers.
Series V: Academic Publications, Drafts, and Manuscripts contains articles and writings by others collected by Grover.

Series VI: Materials from Various Conferences, Lectures, and Campus Events, consists of programs notes; advertising and informational flyers; and other papers relating to Grover’s attendance and involvement with campus, relational, and nation events.
Series VII: Philosophy and Religion Course Materials contains course and club specific papers; syllabi; handouts on Charles Darwin; and honors seminar materials.
Series VIII: Miscellaneous Documents includes individual issues of newsletters kept by Grover; non-academic articles and clippings; materials on campus organization; handouts; and other ephemera.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p:
This collection includes several books which have been separated from the manuscript portion of the collection. The books include:
Hawthore's Little Daffydowndilly and other Stories
Wilsson's First Reader
The Bear Cubbook
A History of Kansas by Anna E. Arnold
The American Red Cross Life Saving and Water Safety
Manual of Parliamentary Practice: Rules of Proceeding and Debate in Deliberative Assemblies by Luther S. Cushing
Morals and Dogma of the Ancient and Accepted scottish Rite of Freemasonry
Seeing Canada with Lowell Thomas
Infantry Fire; Its Use in Battle by Joseph B. Batchelor, Jr.
